info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 4:12AM EDT until June 19 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Cuyahoga River At Jaite affecting Summit and Cuyahoga Counties.
For the Cuyahoga River...including Hiram Rapids, Jaite, Old Portage, Independence...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cuyahoga River at Jaite.
* WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Vaughn Road flooded near the river with a foot or more of water over the roadway.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 215 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON
